means: 使喷出( puff的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He nodded and puffed on a stubby pipe as he listened.
sentence.Network_cn: 他边听边点头，还吸着一支粗短的烟斗。

sentence.Network_en: The British government huffed and puffed at the commission's decision.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国政府对委员会的决定愤愤不满。

sentence.Network_en: As I completed my 26th lap the Porsche puffed blue smoke.
sentence.Network_cn: 我跑了26圈时，保时捷车冒出了蓝烟。

PerfectNetExp.abs: high - performance processing machine of marine puffed fodder ., 高性能水产膨化饲料加工设备.
His eyes were puffed up from lack of sleep ., 由于缺乏睡眠 , 他的眼睛肿了起来.
Mr. Weber superiorly puffed away the absurd misgivings of women ., 韦伯先生高傲地对女人们不合理的忧虑付之一笑.

entry.def: If a part of your body is puffed or puffed up, it is swollen because of an injury or because you are unwell.

example.ex: His face was a little puffed...
His mouth was all puffed up where he had taken a rifle butt.
example.tran: 他的嘴上挨了枪托的地方都肿了起来。

entry.tran: 气喘吁吁的；上气不接下气的
entry.def: If you are puffed or puffed out, you are breathing with difficulty because you have been using a lot of energy.

example.ex: Do you get puffed out running up and down the stairs?
example.tran: 你要是在楼梯上跑上跑下的会不会喘不过气来？

means.word_mean: 1. abnormally distended especially by fluids or gas;

auth_sentence.content: She drew, puffed, expelled long coils of smoke.
auth_sentence.res_content: She drew, puffed, expelled long coils of smoke.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She drew, puffed, expelled long coils of smoke.

auth_sentence.content: Tom Steele puffed and huffed and threatened to sue me.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tom Steele puffed and huffed and threatened to sue me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tom Steele puffed and huffed and threatened to sue me.

auth_sentence.content: Trueman puffed at a cigarette and said he felt fabulous.
auth_sentence.res_content: Trueman puffed at a cigarette and said he felt fabulous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Trueman puffed at a cigarette and said he felt fabulous.
